divs: sighting detailsi took my dogs out in the backyard as have done countless times over 8 years here. as i was standing there looking at the night sky as normal, but this time i saw something different. i noticed what at first i thought was a very low shooting star. in the half second it took to realize this was no shooting star it broke from one solid object into 3 separate orbs. these orbs very quickly fell into formation of a perfect triangle for about one second before taking more of a wide v formation as it disappeared behind trees. the whole event did not take more than 5 seconds total. the object\objects never changed heading or speed during the entire time and was moving much faster than planes i have ever seen fly over this area, and being over the flight path of lambert airport, and 3 smaller airports i have seen all type of plane fly over from commercial, single engine, to military jets. i have never seen anything that has even come close to what i had seen. the object started as a streak of blue-white light with a tail of matching light similar to a comet or shooting star. after it broke it seemed to have much less light, but still same color as it started. wish i had anything record it with, but ain't that the way!
Summary: Started as fireball/comet broke to 3 orbs in formations
trends: There have been 12 other sightings in St Charles
There were no other sightings in St Charles on or around February 29th 2012
